articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Personal Portfolio Web Page hosted with my domain @onelyder
articles.contents:
My Professional competence are mainly within academic finance- and economy literature and theory, but I have based upon this knowledge, build serious experience, competence and knowledge within the field of Data Science. I personally believe combining these two disciplines are very natural and field that belong- and share many common elements.
I use daily code and various programming languages solving mainly analytically problems or/and project assignments. Some of the langues i commonly use are: R & Python. (R = Preferred Language).
Based on the code-syntax knowledge I also master text- and document formatting languages/tools such as Rmarkdown, Latex, Pandoc, HTML and Markdown. Any type of output-format for the final-project report are within my “competence tool-box”, and I really understand the importance of generating the optimal- and a professional looking report.
I use GitHub (terminal git bash) for project admin and version control. Folder structure and working directory are elements I think are essential. I can deliver the same quality and results working on a Windows computer or a Mac. I know how to optimize the workflow on both operating systems.
Please contact me if you want to see any former work and material I have been a part of from my personal portfolio. I would be happy to share it with you and get valuable feedback and perspectives.

            Lyder Aleksander Mathisen
            Associate | Audit and Assurance
            Deloitte AS
            
            Bio
            From my Studies in Finance, my key professional strength, and niche-competence, are combing Data Sience and Finance together. I personally recognized this relationship having Data Science classes in my final semester. And I love it.
            Real Estate, and Optimal Portfolios are my Financial themes of choice. These are of huge professional interest. I am exited about learning more about these subjects from an audit perspective. Code Languages I use daily: R and Python.
            (Btw I like Chess, hmu if you also like to play chess.)
            As a results of coding and analyzing real-estate related problems with virus data,Dynamic and Reproducible Report Documenting are a part of my #toolbox. Text formatting languages such as Markdown, Latex or HTML are example of tools i have used.
